Text: Chlidanthus is a genus that consists of 10 species of tender bulbs from tropical South America, mostly natives to the Andes.
Triplets:<Chlidanthus
1:
--------------------
Text: Chlidanthus:  The botanical name comes from the Greek, meaning "delicate flower".
Triplets:<Chlidanthus
2:
--------------------
Text: Chlidanthus:  The plants have large spherical bulbs with gray-green, strap-shaped leaves 30cm long arising from the base.
Triplets:<Chlidanthus
3:
--------------------
Text: Chlidanthus:  In late spring to early summer, clusters of 3-4 large, strong citrus-scented fragrant, funnel-shaped flowers 10-13cm long held terminally on stalks 25cm high, colored in yellow, pink or red.
